title: PSA: The jungler is not immune to blame
body:
If you gank my lane when there's an huge minion wave at my tower and I don't follow up on your gank, it's your fault for not analyzing my lane before you gank.

If you gank at 40% hp or lower and die it's your fault.

If a lane is getting heavily pressured and ganked and all you do knowing that information is farm your jungle, not take objectives, gank other lanes, counter jungle, push out a lane, it's your fault.

If you over commit to a gank and the enemy already blew their summoners and you dive them then die it's your fault.

If you push the laners lane when they recall and or die causing your wave to go to their tower losing your laner exp. Only exception is pushing lane after a successful gank or holding a laners turret.

If you get an objective stolen from you as Nunu it's your fault.

replies.body: As a jungle main, I fully support this post and have been guilty of all of those infractions at one point or another. However, a lot of people go a little too hard on the "blame the jungle" thing. I mostly play tanky CC junglers, but on occasion I'll play a game of Warwick or something. Had a bot lane feed 6 kills to the enemy before I even hit 6 and the only thing they could say was "Well WW didn't come help." Well, that's true, I didn't, but everyone knows that WW has shite lane presence pre-6. Anyway, If I'm guilty of the infractions YOU listed, fine. It's my fault. But take it easy on the flaming, laners. Best way to get 0 ganks is to tilt your jungler or flame him into being pissed off at you.
Bot lanes generally expect the jungler to be a 10k health 10k burst champion that can blink across the entire map.

You mean the new champion?
{{summoner:31}}

I'd be fine with one gank before laning phase ended lol. 

But that's just me, I have super shitty luck with junglers. Though, I remember one time I had a Nocturne jungler who ganked mid three times and even gave me blue buff. I didn't even ask for it, he just pinged it. That was such an amazing game.

> [{quoted}](name=MCMLXXVIII,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-03-06T14:31:32.881+0000)
>
> As a jungle main, I fully support this post and have been guilty of all of those infractions at one point or another. However, a lot of people go a little too hard on the "blame the jungle" thing. I mostly play tanky CC junglers, but on occasion I'll play a game of Warwick or something. Had a bot lane feed 6 kills to the enemy before I even hit 6 and the only thing they could say was "Well WW didn't come help." Well, that's true, I didn't, but everyone knows that WW has shite lane presence pre-6. Anyway, If I'm guilty of the infractions YOU listed, fine. It's my fault. But take it easy on the flaming, laners. Best way to get 0 ganks is to tilt your jungler or flame him into being pissed off at you.

I don't flame my jungler, but if they don't gank my lane I just tell them to help someone else to kind of relieve pressure or keep pressure on my lane so my jungler is free to help others. I get what you're saying though about the junglers that need level 6 to gank, if I have a warwick, fiddlesticks, ect. on my team I know to play passive until they hit 6 and that's something a lot of laners don't realize.

> [{quoted}](name=Nublu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-03-06T14:43:05.750+0000)
>
> I don't flame my jungler, but if they don't gank my lane I just tell them to help someone else to kind of relieve pressure or keep pressure on my lane so my jungler is free to help others. I get what you're saying though about the junglers that need level 6 to gank, if I have a warwick, fiddlesticks, ect. on my team I know to play passive until they hit 6 and that's something a lot of laners don't realize.

This is the real problem that I have as a jungler. "If you don't gank my lane help someone else to relieve pressure".

The assumption (this has been going on since Season 3, 3 damn years) is that junglers **must** gank **someone** in order to be useful.

I'm a Gold-level Nunu main and I love this game for its intrinsic strategies. I don't gank lanes, I apply pressure in other ways, usually by devouring the enemy jungler's camps over and over and over again. I take my first drag between 5 and 6 minutes and show up to it 20-40 seconds before it spawns every time after that. I take baron on spawn and decimate the enemy team that way, because even though their laners may be ahead in gold with the early game pressure of ganks, their jungler is 3k or so behind and my team has global buffs for days thanks to my objective control. 

Ganking is risky, and it requires substantial APM. Some players just have bad computers, or poor reactions, or don't play mobility focused champions. If that's the case, you shouldn't be shouting at them or flaming them when they aren't ganking. They're playing the game their own way, and when you win at 35 minutes even though you went 0/4 in lane, you should apologize at least.

It's ridiculous how entitled this meta has made laners.

Its mostly the fault of LCS. LCS has heavily favoured champions with strong ganks who provide utility. I mean, look at poor Reksai. {{champion:421}} {{item:1409}} is the only way she is played. Green smite cinderhulk is the most boring jungle enchant combination i can possibly think of. In pro play the jungler has basically become a secondary support (with the exception of Rush) who is supposed to babysit their laners, get them fed, and get them the glory. The only time junglers ever get praise is "Yay you got first blood on that gank!" and then it goes almost solely to adc and mid, the two most toxic roles by far. Also this created the trend of mid laners thinking the blue is ABSOLUTELY ENTITLED TO THEM, regardless of if youre playing a carry jungler or if youre fed and they have fed.

There is not a single time I think I need blue as a mid laner, I do think it's nice to have but don't care if I get it or not. If I'm having issues with mana consistently, I would have already planned out a mana type item that would be a staple for that champion for me.

Youd be shocked how many {{champion:103}} {{champion:7}} and {{champion:105}} type champions i see skipping a mana item because they just assume the blues are theirs. Hell, ive had Zeds demand my blue when im playing {{champion:77}} .
{{item:3165}} is a mana item, you know.
Yes, but {{item:3089}} {{item:3001}} {{item:3157}} arent, which are the items these mid laners rush.

Actually... the very first item you get on leblanc and ahri is morellonomicon... you don't ever rush rabadon's and you only rush abyssal if you're taking it up the butt by an ap mid. Zhonya's is usually also a third item.

...You didnt read my post at all, did you? What i said was when people dont follow their build paths that they should and instead rush a defensive item, they now have mana issues. Because they built these items, they are in desperate need of mana, meaning they just ASSUME the jungler will give them blue buff. This is problematic when the jungler needs the blue buff, or when the mid laner is behind or the jungler is ahead and he can make better use of it. What i am arguing is sometimes mid laners dont rush a mana item when they need to sometimes and put a burden on the jungler, assuming that they are entitled to it.
So rabadon's deathcap is a defensive item? I'll be sure to rush it when I'm getting stomped Kappa

It doesnt necesarrily have to be a defensive item to not be a mana item, now does it? Does it give flat mana? No. Does it give mana regen? No. So in the end, doesnt it mean that if youre a mana hungry champion, youll be assuming your jungler gives you blue? Sure does.

Well, it seems you clearly don't know the game do you?
When i have to go abyssal for the match up, i will have mana problems but better than feeding the enemy laner and then i get a lee sin jungle who needs the blue for whatever stupid reason, yay great. 
Certain match ups like enemy ziggs with blue i NEED blue to fight him, CDR+mana regen otherwise he just spams the fuck out of me, goes ganking and i get flamed for not following up, great.

Oh, im well aware of that. And if they say no, then you have no place in telling him to fuck off. If you are so ineffecient with your mana that you need blue, then run the Meditiation mastery, or stop wasting mana and missing skillshots. Its that simple.  Chances are you dont need to do your typical exaggeration saying that Lee Sin is going to take it, however with some champions like {{champion:77}} {{champion:203}} {{champion:56}} , blue is very beneficial to them as well. Especially if that jungler is going to be ganking alot, running out of mana during a gank FeelsBadMan. 

Also, if you really need help beating a Ziggs, you have bigger issues than blue buff.

> [{quoted}](name=NeoSeraphi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2016-03-06T14:58:50.267+0000)
>
> This is the real problem that I have as a jungler. "If you don't gank my lane help someone else to relieve pressure".
> 
> The assumption (this has been going on since Season 3, 3 damn years) is that junglers **must** gank **someone** in order to be useful.
> 
> I'm a Gold-level Nunu main and I love this game for its intrinsic strategies. I don't gank lanes, I apply pressure in other ways, usually by devouring the enemy jungler's camps over and over and over again. I take my first drag between 5 and 6 minutes and show up to it 20-40 seconds before it spawns every time after that. I take baron on spawn and decimate the enemy team that way, because even though their laners may be ahead in gold with the early game pressure of ganks, their jungler is 3k or so behind and my team has global buffs for days thanks to my objective control. 
> 
> Ganking is risky, and it requires substantial APM. Some players just have bad computers, or poor reactions, or don't play mobility focused champions. If that's the case, you shouldn't be shouting at them or flaming them when they aren't ganking. They're playing the game their own way, and when you win at 35 minutes even though you went 0/4 in lane, you should apologize at least.
> 
> It's ridiculous how entitled this meta has made laners.

I know ganking as Nunu is hard and dude I already stated what you do in my post "farm your jungle, not take objectives, gank other lanes, counter jungle, push out a lane" and you do just that good job. I try not get more than 2 deaths in lane and if I do, as fustrating as it is, I play passive and farm and don't expect my jungler to gank me.

I play almost entirely jungle, and nothing pisses me off more when someone in lane tells me how to play my role. As if I made it this far not knowing what the hell I'm doing.

No offense but I probably already have a plan in mind that is more elaborate than "gank mid Instead"
In their defense you can make it all the way to Gold without knowing what the hell you're doing.

If you are making it all the way to gold not knowing how to jungle then that means you are getting a fuck ton of teams that can 4v5 apparently. Like literally every lane is getting fed and when the enemy jungle shows up they just give top or mid a double kill type deal.
What are you even talking about? That's the stupidest statement I've ever heard.

Seriously? You must not get out much. Trust me, you can "jungle" successfully in Silver without any idea what jungling is about just by being skilled with the champion. I've seen plenty of won games where our jungler just cleared camps until lvl 6, then just ran around killing enemy champions while the ADC and I had to take care of dragon control, warding, etc.

As another person who jungles a lot, when I lane I basically assume that the enemy jungle will camp my lane and I won't see my own jungle all game (even though enemy is pushed). Any other situation that happens is just a plus. Don't die is the main point of laning unless you're an incredibly snowbally champ, which I don't play much. That said, my main jungles are heavy gank champs.

Tldr(not that this was hella long, but I'm restating it anyway): I hella support your statement and any other jungles statement that laners shouldn't and can't necessarily expect ganks.
Just don't complain to your jungler and get mad if you lose lane 1v1 without the enemy team ganking you. It isn't the junglers job to win your lane for you.

No but it is their fault (and is very amusing) when this happens.

Me: Hey i probably won't be able to win this lane alone it's a hard match up. Think i could get some ganks early on?
Jungler: Sure just don't push up to much.

Game go's on no ganks i'm hiding under my tower with 1-2 deaths.

Jungler: Dude Wtf hide under your tower stop dying.
Me: Go look at my corpse i died under that tower where i have been all game (Insert most champions in current meta) can dive me easy. I asked for early ganks you said yes and never showed up. I'v been sitting at my tower waiting for you to come and last hitting as best i can.
Jungler: Muted.

No that's not the Junglers fault, your literally saying "hey I know you have to jungle, but I can't win lane so win it for me" 

Helping is fine, ganking is awesome, but putting that pressure on your jungler basically saying that your going to lose before the game has even started is trash, this goes doubly when you have a devourer jungler.

Lol learn to read please

Hey this is a hard match up think i could get some early ganks.

Jungler: Yeah SURE JUST DON'T PUSH UP TO MUCH 

this is me checking with the jungler LETTING THEM KNOW it's a hard match up, Them saying they will come and gank then NEVER showing up.


That's like a jungler getting invaded and me going, Welp that's your problem right? Yeah i have the time, My lane is pushed i could come you pinged that you needed help. But hey not my issue. You should be able to win it alone right?

> [{quoted}](name=Hunted Horror,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-03-06T14:48:04.444+0000)
>
> Just don't complain to your jungler and get mad if you lose lane 1v1 without the enemy team ganking you. It isn't the junglers job to win your lane for you.

Upvoted.{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

> [{quoted}](name=Hunted Horror,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-03-06T14:48:04.444+0000)
>
> Just don't complain to your jungler and get mad if you lose lane 1v1 without the enemy team ganking you. It isn't the junglers job to win your lane for you.

I don't... I lost my lane 1v1 It's my fault because I got outplayed, or I misplayed, or they're better than me. If I die my a gank it's my fault because I didn't ward or have good map awareness, I fully know that's my fault.

> [{quoted}](name=Nublu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-03-06T13:53:43.921+0000)

> If you get an objective stolen from you as Nunu it's your fault.

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

> [{quoted}](name=Puddinglax,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-03-06T14:56:17.110+0000)
>
> {{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

:p

if i gank your lane i don't care if the minions are in your ass you had best come help me. I swear to god, Just get OVER HERE. i can solo so long as they try to run, but if they turn i'm fucked.

If I'm ganking at 40% or lower that's because the enemy laner is even lower than that, and likely so are you, so when i came to put in the final blow, or to open one up to you, you probably ran away like a bitch. don't do that, if we both hit him we both survive.

if i'm not taking things, it's because you fucks are still pushing. I can't take anything safely alone if everyone is pushed and won't help me. in fact, if you're getting camped you shouldn't be dying more than once to it anyway. are you stupid or something?

if I dive, I don't care if we are diving their spawn pool you had better fucking follow up.

If you aren't in your lane I don't give a rats ass about you anymore, i can push for as long as i want, especially if I get it to the enemy tower because doing that kills the enemies gold. besides, are you retarded? you aren't going to be able to get any of the exp or gold from that wave anyway, You aren't there.

if i get an objective stolen, it happens to anyone, we aren't everywhere, and we can't take every objective on the fucking map at once, but more importantly, it probably got stolen because when i pinged for help 50 times no one fucking got off their lazy farming asses to do shit. like, if we catch an invader, They fucking die. but you are not helping with that apparently, too good for gold i see.


People who blame junglers are people that are stupid. even if the jungler is fucking retarded, if they gank, You had better be fucking nice.

Bad tone and wrong on so many levels. 
First about the "FOLLOW WHEN I GANK"... nope i am not supposed to follow bad calls. If you gank without watching the lane-->jungler fault. 
It's not only about losing cs, if you have two waves pushing on your tower and u just walk through and get aggro you are half dead before u even attack the enemy which could lead to an easy double kill against a renekton or other lane  bullies. 

Second phrase: Depends on where the enemy jungler is otherwise it's an easy double kill again. You can't generalize. 

Third: Really? Most jungler's can towerdive at lvl 3 if you are heavily bullied by enemy laner. My last game as graves against renekton i got camped too and died like 5 times. They just towerdived me together the whole time (enemy jungler was a gragas who ALWAYS came from our jungle, ofc it's not the junglers fault that he simply DON'T ward ANYTHING in his jungle. It's only the laner who should ward, never the jungler. 

Fourth: If you dive i won't follow u up if it's a stupid decision, if you die, still your fault. I guess you are one of those guys diving an Irelia. 

Fifth: I love these pushing junglers, only pushing half a wave so the enemy gets free two waves, is two lvls above and just wrecks my lane. 
If you push, do it right or only lasthit and freeze the wave. 

Sixth: Oh yeah i love it when jungler does dragon with enemy mid alive, bot alive and jungler alive, i am (if i'm mid) pushed to my tower and spam the pings out of me to HELP FFS WHAT ARE U DOING, yeah i just walk to drake i guess they won't suspect anything...

And your last phrase shows u should just uninstall the game, i have no idea where this godcomplex came from you jungler and supports have. 
I guess it's overcompensating for years of being irrelevant.

you're stupid, because you don't understand why you need to do what we need you to do. in jungle we get to make the calls, because we don't have the time to spare on anything that isn't perfect, not these days.

junglers calls are seldom bad. lets say your low enough to lose a one on one, but it would be semi close. if i gank, then i expect you to die for that kill, becuase kill+assist is more valuable than a kill, and our team is better off for it than if you were to just back, as well as it reducing the enemy income by killing the enemy as well, which leaves you in a more even spot than if you had just backed.

its not often that junglers can counter gank, and it can happen, but hoenstly, as a jungler, if i didn't see them on my run in and im coming form a normal route and you as the laner have warded effectively than this should not be an issue unless the enemy junlger was already in the right place to pounce. the chances are very slim, and its a risk worth taking, becuase it has a monstrous effect on winning your lane, as well as setting me up to be able to continue ganking without needing to stop afterwards and focus farm to catch up.


towerdives are decent, but only if we get something guaranteed. if the enemy is low, sure, if they are full health what the fuck do you expect me to do about that. junglers are the weakest members of any team, due to a massive gold and experience deficiency. as well as the fact that yes, It is your fault that your shit isn't warded. its not very hard for jungler to just walk around the normal paths for counter jungle to a position behind you, so you need to make sure that you are warded in the right spot. also, if you get ganked once, don't let them do it again so easily, prepare escapes and watch the enemy junglers pattern, they often do the same things over and over if it works.

if i decide that we are diving, and you don't follow up, it is 100% your fault if i die before they do. of I am diving, then you can literally walk up and fight them without tower aggro. if you don't then you're a selfish and stupid bastard. also, irelia is an easy fuckign dive, she has one hard cc that she will probably use on me, so you had better get your dumb ass over to murder her or i swear to god. people that come in late are the reason why dives seem so bad all the time.

fifth, honestly, as a jungler, if you acted like this post to me in game. I would literally try to sabotage you in any way i could,. also, if the enemy laner comes back and i don't think i can take them, i will just pack and leave before you get there, but that is about the only reason why i wouldn't push your lane all the way to the enemy tower. stop being an entitled prick and lording over your minions, we need gold much much more desperately than you do.

honestly, that is just a stupid jungler, but a normal jungler needs you to be there, if we have killed the enemy jungler and maybe their bot lane and we are kind of low, we need the mid laner to get out of their lane to come down and help take the dragon.

also, other buffs, if we get invaded, you help us. no questions. no, "I was fighting my laner", no "but I need to farm" none of that. you want a jungler that game you help him out.


and this whole stupid shit that laners like you have about supports and jungler being irrelevant is fucking stupid as all hell. when you carry you forget about us. but when you lose it's always somehow our faults. if we are so irrelevant how come you can't win without us.

> [{quoted}](name=macromite,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=000600020000,timestamp=2016-03-06T18:46:14.864+0000)
> junglers calls are seldom bad.

[https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/3/3b/Paris_Tuileries_Garden_Facepalm_statue.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/3/3b/Paris_Tuileries_Garden_Facepalm_statue.jpg)

> junglers calls are seldom bad. l

You're bronze I. I'd wager most of your calls are bad.
considering that's your argument, here's mine. my calls are nearly always correct, in bronze, and i expect that a diamond jungler is nearly always correct, in diamond.

> [{quoted}](name=macromite,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=00060002000000030000,timestamp=2016-03-07T03:50:12.353+0000)
>
> considering that's your argument, here's mine. my calls are nearly always correct, in bronze, and i expect that a diamond jungler is nearly always correct, in diamond.

There is no reason to assume that.
based on my research I can almost promise it.

> [{quoted}](name=macromite,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=0006000200000003000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-07T05:32:58.732+0000)
>
> based on my research I can almost promise it.

There is no reason to assume you have done research.

You're not a special snowflake or a diamond in the rough for playing jungler. You're just another player in the game. No one has to listen to a thing you say.

there is no grounds to any of your statements. you have simply decided to write me off.

I never suggested i was better than my mmr, what I suggest is that I know more than what it might seem. also, note how I worded my statement to specify a separation in the diamond and the bronze.


I believe that your metal seeing eyes are pointless. rank means nothing unless you are the best, I have beaten enough higher ranked players to know that some of the worst can reside in the higher mmr.

also, the research i have done involves talking with and playing with players from different tiers of play, excluding master and challenger as I have not personally met anyone of that tier. i could name drop but you probably wouldn't care.

For future reference, never expect to know more than someone, on the off chance that you're wrong you will have lost their respect and any ability to learn from them.

> [{quoted}](name=macromite,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=000600020000000300000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-07T06:44:20.463+0000)
>
> there is no grounds to any of your statements. you have simply decided to write me off.

> I never suggested i was better than my mmr, what I suggest is that I know more than what it might seem. also, note how I worded my statement to specify a separation in the diamond and the bronze.

> I believe that your metal seeing eyes are pointless. rank means nothing unless you are the best, I have beaten enough higher ranked players to know that some of the worst can reside in the higher mmr.
> 
> also, the research i have done involves talking with and playing with players from different tiers of play, excluding master and challenger as I have not personally met anyone of that tier. i could name drop but you probably wouldn't care.
> 
> For future reference, never expect to know more than someone, on the off chance that you're wrong you will have lost their respect and any ability to learn from them.

I'm still waiting on your evidence that the jungler is almost always right and the dumb laners are almost always wrong.

Also, fuck jungler pity parties. They're almost as bad as support hug boxes.

things wrong with your points.

A. I never said that laners are mostly wrong. specifically I said that junglers are mostly right. if you're a laner that fights with your jungler. you are wrong most the time, but that's a personal case.



It has been put it perfectly as to why these roles get pity parties and hug boxes and why top/mid/adc do not.

quote from GayFluffyUnicorn 
"And your last phrase shows u should just uninstall the game, i have no idea where this godcomplex came from you jungler and supports have.
I guess it's overcompensating for years of being irrelevant."

the people who main the other roles consider us pointless. irrelevant. they act like we aren't even part of the game besides to blame us. they make our roles a little less enjoyable as both supports and jungler know that they will often never get any respect in the game, but their plays when capitalized on will give someone else respect.

and people wonder why there is a support drought. no one wants to play it because no one notices them and gives them any respect for their plays.

> [{quoted}](name=macromite,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MmMcm5kb,comment-id=00060002000000030000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-07T15:51:37.020+0000)
>
> things wrong with your points.
> 
> A. I never said that laners are mostly wrong. specifically I said that junglers are mostly right. 

You also have yet to validate this incredibly biased claim, so there's no real reason for me to keep reading your worthless post. =) But I'm a nice guy, so I will.

Some people who main the other roles consider yours pointless. Some people who main jungle think that their laners are imbeciles who are almost always in the wrong if they disagree with their jungler (this is you by the way). Some people who main support think that adcs are worthless little shits who need to be completely carried by the support player until they can scale and are entitled shitheads.

And as a top lane main (I secondary jungle by the way) some people think that I'm a largely irrelevant buffer keeping top turret from being taken who has little impact on the game as a whole.

Supports and junglers get pity parties because they seem to be the whiniest and most entitled players of all (along with adcs I guess). I almost never get compliments and honors as a top laner or as a jungler, even if I am solo carrying. 

Stop showing off your insecurity on the boards, because I assure you, none of us care.

Oh, and the jungler is an idiot just as often as a laner is. Your role is not special.

what the best call or decision is does not change based on elo. 
Just because something works out does not mean it was the best call.

false, calls change dramatically based on elo, in higher elo the better calls are the safer calls, the more reliable calls, where in lower elo the best calls are the aggressive calls. this is due to the difference in playstyle created by skill and playing around differently skilled players.

"i can push for as long as i want, especially if I get it to the enemy tower because doing that kills the enemies gold. besides, are you retarded? you aren't going to be able to get any of the exp or gold from that wave anyway, You aren't there."

If you're pushing my lane you damn well better go to the tower.
hell, when I leave lane as adc, I expect the support to last hit. Hell, I do it as support because otherwise that gold's just going to waste.

I'm fine with all this. Just 

1. Do not ask for a gank and then take your sweet time jumping in when I engage. Hell, it might work better if you engage first depending on the situation.

2. Don't go in my jungle and take my farm. Idgaf if you say you need blue. At least ask before you do that shit because If I'm playing a mana hungry jungler I'm going to need it and you need to play safe til I get there if you absolutely just can't survive without it.

3. Seriously, stop pushing if you want a gank so bad. I'm not diving a full hp Morgana.

4. It's not my fault the enemy jungler caught you. Especially if i threw a ward down for you. Don't expect them not to show up when you are literally right outside the enemy turret range.
